descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course addresses family relationships and their communication processes or how members' interactions create and maintain families. Replying on a framework of family functions the courses focuses on how family members accomplish the following: developing communication patterns that affect future generations, manage members' intimacy and conflict patterns, move through developmental stages over time while managing developmental and unpredictable stressors and improve their interaction patterns. Essentially this course addresses how families learn to use relational concepts to describe, and make sense of, the recurring patterns of communication developed and enacted by family members.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Galvin, K. Braithwaite, D and Bylund, C (2015) Family Communication: Cohesion and Change. Routledge (9th ed.) (The earlier edition would also work 8th ed.)

978-0205945238
